blogData.title: AI is here to help; translation at the tip of your ears; and Google's ALBERT   is receiving top ranks
blogData.description:
Read on to get up to date on some of the most interesting things coming
  out of the world of Artificial Intelligence. There's also top ranking machine learning
  systems and earbuds that can translate languages as you're hearing them.
blogData.keywords: AI, translation, machine learning, earbuds, Google, Artificial Intelligence, robot, job creation, youtube subtitles, video caption, youtube captions

data.richContent:
There’s been a lot going on with AI in particular this week. Read on to get up to date on some of the most interesting things coming out of the world of Artificial Intelligence. There’s also top ranking machine learning systems and earbuds that can translate languages as you’re hearing them.

1. Yes Bank creates ‘Yes Robot’ using Microsoft Cognitive Services

A bank in India has created AI assistant, ‘Yes Robot’ to provide 24 hour customer service to its patrons. Chief digital officer at Yes Bank, Ritesh Pai said that “increasing use of Yes Robot has taken a significant load from customer service teams and resulted in improved levels of customer satisfaction.”

Read more here

2. Artificial intelligence will lead to creation of 133 million jobs around the world, says report

Many worry about the development in AI and the negative effects it could have on humanity, but the latest report is showing us it’s not at all doom and gloom. AI-influenced jobs are already in demand and the need for these skills are continuing to grow globally.

Read more here

3. These wireless earbuds can translate languages as you hear them

“Parlez-vous anglais?” Gone are the days of wandering around a foreign country looking for someone who speaks your language. These earbuds by Aunu Audio, translate over 30 different languages so that you can understand what people are saying, as they’re saying it.

Read more here

4. 10 ways AI and machine learning are improving endpoint security

AI and machine learning for the win! This time in combating against cyber attacks and detecting and stopping malware attacks.

Read more here

5. Google AI’s ALBERT claims top spot in multiple NLP performance benchmarks

Leave it to Google to create start-of-the-art technology. This time it’s ALBERT, an AI that has ranked first place on NLP leader-boards such as GLUE and SQuAD 2.0. The model achieves results in testing that outperforms human capability.

Conclusion

Please connect with us on LinkedIn, YouTube or Facebook for any comments, questions, or just to keep up to date with the work we do!

We are very grateful for your support!

If you haven’t yet and are interested in trying out our technology, please try our platform, or drop us an email at hello@videotranslator.ai.

nodes.title: The Girls and Women Revitalising Canada's Indigenous Languages
nodes.description:
It was International Women's Day this past Sunday 8 March and in honour
  of the day we're looking at some incredible females who are doing all they can for
  their native languages.
nodes.coverAlt: International Women's Day, girls in language

nodes.title: Fighting the Coronavirus and E. Coli with Machine Learning
nodes.description:
When it comes to combating superbugs and viruses, the human raced needs
  all the help it can get. Artificial Intelligence is being implemented to find treatments
  to fight bacteria that was formally resistant to all forms of antibiotics.

nodes.title: AI & Wildlife Preservation
nodes.description:
If there's one thing most of us can agree on, it's that wildlife preservation
  is important. Using Artificial Intelligence, researchers are fighting the good fight
  against wildlife population decline. And in a surprising twist, AI might just help
  us win this fight.
